column4: i`m always saying something twice when i need help and especially at massive channels because it happens often nobody to see my question.
thank you and mind your attitude when trying to help - it does not make a good impression ...

if they were not any requirements about ircd client when linking a server to a national network - I would never use linux ... it sux - the most unfriendly operating system in the world ... when it comes to ANYTHING ... they shall forbid it ... jeesh
well he started 1st
why am i even talking to freaks ... what a pathetic excuse for an OS Linux is ... Linux developers should kill themselves ...
People will be more than happy to help, just don;t be inflammatory
Well what's your problem?
it looks liek there's a package for ircd-ratbox in ubuntu
what was the terminal command once again, I was updating and Ubuntu Restrted my PC ...
sudo apt-get install (package name here)
thank you onace again
and then type the admin password. It won't echo (show up on the screen) btw
can i bother you a bit on private?
sure
are you still there? My client set you to ignore
yes i am
i'm still figuring out how to use my IRC client
you should be able to launch it from the terminal
and how do i do that?
try typing the name of the command in the Terminal
try typing ircd:ratbox in the Terminal
any luck?
